 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פָּנָה‎</span><sub>135</sub> **verb** ==turn== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פְּנָא‎</span>; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">: Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***pass away, banish***; compare Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פנה‎</span> (variously) e.g. [[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>iv. Nos. 1, 37, 40</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***pânu***</u></abbr>, ***face***, Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פנם‎</span>, [[BDB#MI|MI]]<sup>13, 18</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לפני‎</span>, suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מפני‎</span> [[Ezek.1.19|Ezek 1:19]]); — 

**Qal**<sub>117</sub> ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פ‎</span> [[Jer.6.4|Jer 6:4]] +, 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פָּנִיתָ‎</span> [[2Sam.9.8|2Sam 9:8]], etc.; ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִפְנֶה‎</span> [[1Sam.13.17|1Sam 13:17]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּ֫פֶן‎</span> [[Exod.2.12|Exod 2:12]] +, 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתֵּ֫פֶן‎</span> [[1Kgs.10.13|1Kgs 10:13]], 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וָאֵ֫פֶן‎</span> [[Deut.9.15|Deut 9:15]]; [[Deut.10.5|Deut 10:5]], 1 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַנֵּ֫פֶן‎</span> [[Deut.2.1|Deut 2:1]] +, etc.; ***Imperative*** masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פְּנֵה‎</span> [[Ps.25.16|Ps 25:16]] +, etc.; ***Infinitiveabsolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פָּנֹה‎</span> [[Hag.1.9|Hag 1:9]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנוֺת‎</span> [[Gen.24.63|Gen 24:63]] +, etc.; ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פֹּנֶה‎</span> [[Deut.29.17|Deut 29:17]] +, etc.; — 

**1.** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***turn*** toward, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> person, literal, [[Judg.6.14|Judg 6:14]]; [[Isa.13.14|Isa 13:14]] = [[Jer.50.16|Jer 50:16]]; [[Job.21.5|Job 21:5]] (i.e. attentively); compare of branches [[Ezek.17.6|Ezek 17:6]] (in allegory); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> of direction [[Gen.24.49|Gen 24:49]] figurative with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶליֿ‎</span> (in worship), [[Isa.45.22|Isa 45:22]], other gods [[Hos.3.1|Hos 3:1]]; [[Deut.31.18|Deut 31:18]]; [[Deut.31.20|Deut 31:20]]; [[Lev.19.4|Lev 19:4]] for help [[Lev.19.31|Lev 19:31]]; [[Lev.20.6|Lev 20:6]]; [[Job.5.1|Job 5:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלאָֿוֶן‎</span> [[Job.36.21|Job 36:21]] with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמָּקוֺם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשֶׁר יִפְנֶה‎</span> [[Ezek.10.11|Ezek 10:11]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ה‎</span> locative [[1Kgs.17.3|1Kgs 17:3]]; [[Deut.2.3|Deut 2:3]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָכֶם‎</span> dativus ethicus [dative of interest]), [[Song.6.1|Song 6:1]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֶּרֶךְ‎</span> [[1Sam.13.18|1Sam 13:18]] (twice in verse); [[Job.24.18|Job 24:18]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלדֿ‎</span> [[Judg.20.42|Judg 20:42]]; [[1Sam.13.17|1Sam 13:17]] figurative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְדֶרֶךְ‎</span> [[Isa.53.6|Isa 53:6]]; [[Isa.56.11|Isa 56:11]] with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֹּל אֲשֶׁריִֿפְנֶה‎</span> [[1Sam.14.47|1Sam 14:47]], so, + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁם‎</span>, figurative [[1Kgs.2.3|1Kgs 2:3]], i.e. whatever thou undertakest, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלכָּֿלאֲֿשֶׁר יִפְנֶה‎</span> [[Prov.17.8|Prov 17:8]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***turn*** from, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> local [[Gen.18.22|Gen 18:22]], figurative, of heart, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵעִם י‎</span> [[Deut.29.17|Deut 29:17]], absolute = ***turn away*** [[Deut.30.17|Deut 30:17]] in phrase <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹרֶף‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פ‎</span> ***turn*** (with) ***the back*** (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ראה עֹרֶף‎</span>) [[Jer.18.17|Jer 18:17]]), + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנֵי‎</span>, [[Josh.7.12|Josh 7:12]] (of flight), figurative, + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶליֿ‎</span>, [[Jer.2.27|Jer 2:27]]; [[Jer.32.33|Jer 32:33]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** ***turn*** and do a thing, literal (especially + verb of motion) [[Num.21.33|Num 21:33]]; [[Deut.1.7|Deut 1:7]]; [[Deut.1.24|Deut 1:24]]; [[Judg.18.21|Judg 18:21]]; [[1Kgs.10.13|1Kgs 10:13]] + 17 t.; to do a thing (infinitive) [[Eccl.2.12|Eccl 2:12]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.*****turn, decline***, of day [[Jer.6.4|Jer 6:4]], days of life [[Ps.90.9|Ps 90:9]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** ***turn toward, approach***, of evening, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנוֺת עָ֑רֶב‎</span> [[Gen.24.63|Gen 24:63]]; [[Deut.23.12|Deut 23:12]] of morning, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(הַ)בֹּקֶר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפ‎</span> [[Exod.14.27|Exod 14:27]]; [[Judg.19.26|Judg 19:26]]; [[Ps.46.6|Ps 46:6]] (figurative). 

**2. a.** ***turn and look, look***, literal, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> person [[Num.12.10|Num 12:10]]; [[2Chr.20.24|2Chr 20:24]]; [[2Chr.26.20|2Chr 26:20]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּפֶן כֹּה וָכֹה‎</span> [[Exod.2.12|Exod 2:12]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמָ֑עְלָה‎</span> [[Isa.8.21|Isa 8:21]] absolute ***look*** (back) [[2Chr.13.14|2Chr 13:14]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַתֲרִי‎</span> ***look behind one*** (and see, or say), [[Josh.8.20|Josh 8:20]]; [[Judg.20.40|Judg 20:40]]; [[2Sam.1.7|2Sam 1:7]]; [[2Sam.2.20|2Sam 2:20]]; [[2Kgs.2.24|2Kgs 2:24]], ***look after*** anotber [[Ezek.29.16|Ezek 29:16]] (figurative for seek alliance with); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> of direction [[Exod.16.10|Exod 16:10]]; [[Num.17.7|Num 17:7]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** of inanimate things, ***face***, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> location [[Josh.15.7|Josh 15:7]], usually of facing points of compass, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ה‎</span> locative [[1Kgs.7.25|1Kgs 7:25]] (4 t. in verse) = [[2Chr.4.4|2Chr 4:4]] (4 t. in verse), [[Josh.15.2|Josh 15:2]]; [[Ezek.8.3|Ezek 8:3]]; [[Ezek.46.19|Ezek 46:19]], but also with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קָדִים‎</span> [[Ezek.43.17|Ezek 43:17]]; [[Ezek.44.1|Ezek 44:1]]; [[Ezek.46.1|Ezek 46:1]]; [[Ezek.46.12|Ezek 46:12]]; [[Ezek.47.2|Ezek 47:2]], compare [[Ezek.43.1|Ezek 43:1]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** especially figurative***look*** at,<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלֿ‎</span> person, ***regard***, (1) graciously [[2Sam.9.8|2Sam 9:8]] of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> [[Ezek.36.9|Ezek 36:9]]; [[Lev.26.9|Lev 26:9]]; [[2Kgs.13.23|2Kgs 13:23]]; [[Ps.40.5|Ps 40:5]], + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָנַן‎</span> [[Ps.25.16|Ps 25:16]]; [[Ps.69.17|Ps 69:17]]; [[Ps.86.16|Ps 86:16]]; [[Ps.119.132|Ps 119:132]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלתְּֿפִלָּה‎</span> [[1Kgs.8.28|1Kgs 8:28]] = [[2Chr.6.19|2Chr 6:19]]; [[Ps.102.18|Ps 102:18]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלמִֿנְחָה‎</span> [[Num.16.15|Num 16:15]]; [[Mal.2.13|Mal 2:13]] (2) sternly, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶלקְֿשִׁי הָעָם‎</span> [[Deut.9.27|Deut 9:27]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** ***look*** for (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> of thing) = expect [[Hag.1.9|Hag 1:9]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** figurative ***look*** at (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> of thing) = consider [[Eccl.2.11|Eccl 2:11]]. — [[2Chr.25.23|2Chr 25:23]] see <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּנָּה‎</span> **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פִּנָּה‎</span> [[Zeph.3.15|Zeph 3:15]], etc.; ***Imperative*** masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּנּוּ‎</span> [[Isa.40.3|Isa 40:3]] + 2 t.; — ***turn away, put out of the way***, with accusative of person [[Zeph.3.15|Zeph 3:15]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵסִיר‎</span>); hence ***make clear***, with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַבַּיִת‎</span>, i.e. clear away things scattered about, make orderly, German 'aufräumen' [[Gen.24.31|Gen 24:31]] ***empty*** it [[Lev.14.36|Lev 14:36]] figurative, with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֶּרֶךְ‎</span> ***make clear***, free from obstacles, [[Isa.40.3|Isa 40:3]]; [[Isa.57.14|Isa 57:14]]; [[Isa.62.10|Isa 62:10]]; [[Mal.3.1|Mal 3:1]] accusative omitted ***clear away*** (ground) before it, i.e. to plant it [[Ps.80.10|Ps 80:10]] (figurative). **Hiph\`il** (especially Jeremiah) ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִפְנָה‎</span> [[Jer.48.39|Jer 48:39]], 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִפְנְתָה‎</span> [[Jer.49.24|Jer 49:24]], etc.; ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיֶּ֫פֶן‎</span> [[Judg.15.4|Judg 15:4]] ***Infinitive construct*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַפְנֹתוֺ‎</span> [[1Sam.10.9|1Sam 10:9]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַפְנֶה‎</span> [[Nah.2.9|Nah 2:9]] — 

**1.** ***turn***, with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיֶּפֶן זָנָב אֶלזָֿנָב‎</span> [[Judg.15.4|Judg 15:4]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹרֶף‎</span> [[Jer.48.39|Jer 48:39]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הפך‎</span> [[Josh.7.8|Josh 7:8]]), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁכְמוֺ לָלֶכֶת‎</span> [[1Sam.10.9|1Sam 10:9]]. 

**2.** ***make a turn, shew*** (signs of) ***turning***, + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָסוּ‎</span> [[Jer.46.21|Jer 46:21]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָנוּם‎</span> [[Jer.49.24|Jer 49:24]] opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָסוּ‎</span> [[Jer.46.5|Jer 46:5]], compare [[Nah.2.9|Nah 2:9]] + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> person [[Nah.47.3|Nah 47:3]]. **Hoph\`al** ***Imperative*** masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָפְנוּ‎</span> [[Jer.49.8|Jer 49:8]] ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:46a»§ 46a</sup>, N.) ***be ye turned back!*** (in flight, + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֻסוּ‎</span>); ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָפְנֶה צָפ֫וֺנָה‎</span> [[Ezek.9.2|Ezek 9:2]] the gate . . . ***which is faced northward*** (compare **Qal 2 b**.
